<p>This processor logs to a timeseries f:
This processor logs to a timeseries feed which can then be used to explore historic data. This is recommended for logging power, temperature, humidity, voltage and current data.

Feed engine:

  • Emoncms Fixed Interval TimeSeries (PHPFina) is the recommended feed engine, it is a fixed interval timeseries engine.
  • Emoncms Variable Interval TimeSeries (PHPTimeseries) is for data posted at a non regular interval.

Feed interval: When selecting the feed interval select an interval that is the same as, or longer than the update rate that is set in your monitoring equipment. Setting the interval rate to be shorter than the update rate of the equipment causes un-needed disk space to be used up.
<p>Multiplies current value by given con: Multiplies current value by given constant. This can be useful for calibrating a particular variable on the web rather than by reprogramming hardware.
Offset current value by given value. This can again be useful for calibrating a particular variable on the web rather than by reprogramming hardware.
<p>Convert a power value in Watts to a c:
Convert a power value in Watts to a cumulative kWh feed.

Visualisation tip: Feeds created with this input processor can be used to generate daily kWh data using the BarGraph visualisation with the delta property set to 1. See Guide: Daily kWh
<p>Convert a power value in Watts to a f: Convert a power value in Watts to a feed that contains an entry for the total energy used each day (kWh/d)
<p>Multiplies the current value with the: Multiplies the current value with the last value from other input as selected from the input list.
<p>Counts the amount of time that an inp: Counts the amount of time that an input is high in each day and logs the result to a feed. Created for counting the number of hours a solar hot water pump is on each day
<p>Accumulate Wh measurements into kWh\/:
Accumulate Wh measurements into kWh/d.

Input: energy increments in Wh.
<p>Updates or inserts daily value on the: Updates or inserts daily value on the specified time (given by the JSON time parameter from the API) of the specified feed
<p>Adds the current value with the last: Adds the current value with the last value from other input as selected from the input list. The result is passed back for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
<p>Divides the current value with the la: Divides the current value with the last value from other input as selected from the input list. The result is passed back for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
<p>Output feed is the difference between: Output feed is the difference between the current value and the last
Total pulse count to pulse increment: Total pulse count to pulse increment
<p>Returns the number of pulses incremen: Returns the number of pulses incremented since the last update for a input that is a cumulative pulse count. i.e If the input updates from 23400 to 23410 the result will be an incremenet of 10.
<p>Subtracts from the current value the: Subtracts from the current value the last value from other input as selected from the input list.
<p>Negative values are zeroed for furthe: Negative values are zeroed for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
<p>Positive values are zeroed for furthe: Positive values are zeroed for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
<p>Convert a number that was interpreted: Convert a number that was interpreted as a 16 bit signed number to an unsigned number.
<p>Maximal daily value. Upserts on the s: Maximal daily value. Upserts on the selected daily feed the highest value reached each day.
<p>Minimal daily value. Upserts on the s: Minimal daily value. Upserts on the selected daily feed the lowest value reached each day.
<p>Adds the current value with the last: Adds the current value with the last value from a feed as selected from the feed list.
<p>Subtracts from the current value the: Subtracts from the current value the last value from a feed as selected from the feed list.
<p>Multiplies the current value with the: Multiplies the current value with the last value from a feed as selected from the feed list.
<p>Divides the current value by the last: Divides the current value by the last value from a feed as selected from the feed list.
<p>The value \"0\" is passed back for fu: The value "0" is passed back for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
Use with emontx, emonth or emonpi pulsec:
Use with emontx, emonth or emonpi pulsecount or an emontx running firmware emonTxV3_4_continuous_kwhtotals sending cumulative watt hours.

This processor ensures that when the emontx is reset the watt hour count in emoncms does not reset, it also checks filter's out spikes in energy use that are larger than a max power threshold set in the processor, assuming these are error's, the max power threshold is set to 60 kW.

Visualisation tip: Feeds created with this input processor can be used to generate daily kWh data using the BarGraph visualisation with the delta property set to 1 and scale set to 0.001. See: Guide: Daily kWh
<p>Publishes value to REDIS for phpmqtt_: Publishes value to REDIS for phpmqtt_input.php to publish the values to MQTT topic e.g. 'home/power/kitchen'
<p>Value is set to NULL.<\/p><p>Useful f:
Value is set to NULL.

Useful for conditional process to work on.
<p>The value is set to the original valu: The value is set to the original value at the start of the process list.
<p>If value from last process is ZERO, p: If value from last process is ZERO, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is NOT ZER: If value from last process is NOT ZERO, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is NULL, p: If value from last process is NULL, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is NOT NUL: If value from last process is NOT NULL, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is greater: If value from last process is greater than the specified value, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
If value from last process is greater or equal to the specified value, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is lower t: If value from last process is lower than the specified value, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is lower o: If value from last process is lower or equal to the specified value, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is equal t: If value from last process is equal to the specified value, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>If value from last process is NOT equ: If value from last process is NOT equal to the specified value, process execution will skip execution of next process in list.
<p>Jumps the process execution to the sp:
Jumps the process execution to the specified position.

Warning
If you're not careful you can create a goto loop on the process list.
When a loop occurs, the API will appear to lock until the server php times out with an error.
<p><b>Source Feed:<\/b><br>Virtual feeds:
Source Feed:
Virtual feeds should use this processor as the first one in the process list. It sources data from the selected feed.
The sourced value is passed back for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
You can then add other processors to apply logic on the passed value for post-processing calculations in realtime.

Note: This virtual feed process list is executed on visualizations requests that use this virtual feed.
<p>Divide by specified feed. Returns NUL: Divide by specified feed. Returns NULL for zero values.
<p>Return the reciprical of the specifie: Return the reciprical of the specified feed. Returns NULL for zero values.
<p>This was automaticaly added when a lo: This was automaticaly added when a loop error was discovered on the processList or execution took too many steps to process. Review the usage of GOTOs or decrease the number of items and delete this entry to resume execution.
<p>If value is greater than <i>max value: If value is greater than max value allowed then the value passed to following process will be the max value allowed
<p>If value is lower than <i>min value a: If value is lower than min value allowed then the value passed to following process will be the min value allowed
<p>Return the absolute value of the curr: Return the absolute value of the current value. This can be useful for calibrating a particular variable on the web rather than by reprogramming hardware.
This processor removes resets from a cum:
This processor removes resets from a cumulative kWh input, it also filter's out spikes in energy use that are larger than a max power threshold set in the processor, assuming these are error's, the max power threshold is set to 60 kW.

Visualisation tip: Feeds created with this input processor can be used to generate daily kWh data using the BarGraph visualisation with the delta property set to 1 and scale set to 0.001. See: Guide: Daily kWh
<p>In addition to the standard log to fe: In addition to the standard log to feed process, this process links missing data points with a straight line between the newest value and the previous value. It is designed for use with total cumulative kWh meter reading inputs, producing a feed that can be used with the delta property when creating bar graphs. See: Guide: Daily kWh
<p>Limits the current value by the last: Limits the current value by the last value from an input as selected from the input list. The result is passed back for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
Limits the current value by the last value from an feed as selected from the feed list. The result is passed back for further processing by the next processor in the processing list.
<p>Convert a power value in Watts to a f: Convert a power value in Watts to a feed that contains an entry for the total energy used every 15 min (starting mid night) (kWh/15min)
Slot in minutes slot to accumulate: Slot in minutes slot to accumulate
<p>Convert a power value in Watts to a f: Convert a power value in Watts to a feed that contains an entry for the total energy used every selected minutes (starting mid night) (kWh/x min)
Process list must be an array: Process list must be an array
Missing process key in process list at i: Missing process key in process list at index $index
Invalid or missing args in process list: Invalid or missing args in process list at index $index
Invalid number of arguments for process:: Invalid number of arguments for process: $processkey
Processes are executed sequentially with: Processes are executed sequentially with the result value being passed down for further processing to the next processor on this processing list.

If you want to call any of the following: If you want to call any of the following actions when your not logged in you have this options to authenticate with the API key:
Append on the URL of your request: &apik: Append on the URL of your request: &apikey=APIKEY
Add the HTTP header: \"Authorization: Be: Add the HTTP header: "Authorization: Bearer APIKEY"
To use the json api the request url need: To use the json api the request url needs to include .json
